The woman standing before you is older than your oldest aunt. Her thin, pale face and bony hands make her look fragile, like a fading signature in an antique book. But her eyes remember everything they have ever seen.|
|
You appraise one another for a long moment before she breaks the ice. "Welcome in, welcome!" she chortles. "Don't get many visitors this late in the day."|

with a gold crown on its head and a jeweled scepter in its paw. On the floor near the throne is another crowned

, rising from its throne to greet you. "I am Anatinus, King of

The
"My messengers have told me of your quest," continues

. "Allow me to repay your kindness with words of advice."|
|
The old
motions you to his side. "The Tower of

is formidable," he begins in a low, serious voice. "You will never get inside unaided. Legends speak of a Magick Word that can open the gates of the Tower. But what Word it is, none can say."|
|

. "Take this," he says, holding it out to you.

and clamps onto its forefoot. The

viciously and tries in vain to shake it off. You stare in wonder as the fighting boxes swell to twice their normal size, then four times larger, eight times!|

The
frees itself with a savage twist and bends to finish its foe. The

dodges, grips the descending lid and holds on for dear life. Locked in mortal combat, the giant boxes roll over and over, shaking the earth with the thunder of battle.|
|

"Hop on!"|

|
The

have stopped hooting and started screaming. Timidly, you open one eye.|

s! They leap from the waves like wet little rockets, splashing the
with black, oily water. Many of the

have already slipped and fallen into the sea; and a black fin is gliding confidently in their direction.|
|
"What are you waiting for? Halloween?"|
|
The familiar
at your ear urges you to a nearby buoy. You grasp it with your last ounce of strength and feel yourself speeding across the bay, propelled by dozens of

s reined to the buoy with seaweed.|
|
"I don't mind returning a favor," remarks the
as your brain sinks into oblivion, "but can't you pick a better night to go swimming?"

A searing bolt of lightning shatters the night! It strikes the glowing Stone of Dreams, and fractures the sky into a billion raindrops.|
|
Everything around you is soaked in a brief but savage downpour.
Your vision clears as the thick fog sinks away.||
A flood of rainwater cascades down Lookout Hill, quickly filling the narrow pit.
The platypus swims gracefully out and shakes herself off.||
